executive_summary.overall_assessment: IoS-016 Economic Calendar schema passes G1 Technical Validation. All core structural tests (QG-F1 through QG-F4) achieve 100% coverage. Integration tests (QG-F5, QG-F6) appropriately deferred to G3.
executive_summary.audit_defensibility: I would be comfortable defending this in audit.

test_results.DST_SPRING_FORWARD: PASS - Pre/post DST events maintain correct 47h delta (spring forward loses 1h)
test_results.ALL_TIMESTAMPTZ: PASS - All 29 timestamp columns use TIMESTAMPTZ

findings.key_invariant_verified: At any time, an auditor can answer: Why did this source win?

what_was_tested: Schema creation and structure (11 tables, 7 FKs, 100+ constraints)
Timezone normalization (EST, CET, JST to UTC)
DST edge case handling (spring forward, fall back)
Time precision enforcement (DATE_ONLY, HOUR, MINUTE, SECOND)
Source conflict resolution with domain-specific reliability
Conflict logging and explainability audit trail
Event proximity tagging function (EVENT_ADJACENT, NEUTRAL, POST_EVENT)
what_was_NOT_tested: Real provider API responses (mitigated: staging table validates payload structure)
Production calendar data volume (mitigated: schema constraints prevent malformed data)
CEIO Ed25519 signatures (mitigated: ceio_signature nullable, validation pre-G4)
Asset Brier alert triggering (deferred to G3 runtime)
Ingestion batch hash chain integrity (deferred to G3 operational test)
Provider quota tracking in production (deferred to G3)

technical_debt_accepted.reason: Require integration/runtime validation not possible in G1
technical_debt_accepted.mitigation: Will be validated in G3 Audit Verification (24h operational test)

technical_debt_accepted.reason: ADR-008 scope extends to G2, not G1
technical_debt_accepted.mitigation: ceio_signature field exists but nullable; enforcement added pre-G4

technical_debt_accepted.reason: No live provider integrations in G1
technical_debt_accepted.mitigation: TOS capture implemented; will be populated in G2 provider integration

surfaces.reason: Cannot simulate real provider behavior without live calls
surfaces.mitigation: Staging table validates payload structure; live testing in G3.5 Shadow Mode

surfaces.reason: Cannot simulate months of historical data in G1
surfaces.mitigation: Schema constraints prevent malformed data; G3 includes 24h operational test

surfaces.reason: Signature enforcement deferred to G2 (ADR-008 scope)
surfaces.mitigation: ceio_signature field nullable; signature validation added pre-G4

migrations_executed.purpose: Schema creation, table definitions, seed data
Test registry, coverage functions, untestable surfaces

audit_defensibility_statement: I would be comfortable defending this in audit. The IoS-016 Economic Calendar schema demonstrates: (1) Complete structural integrity with 100% coverage on core tests QG-F1 through QG-F4, (2) Temporal correctness verified across timezones and DST transitions, (3) ADR-013 compliant source reconciliation with auditable conflict resolution, (4) Explicit documentation of untestable surfaces with mitigations, (5) All pending tests are appropriately scoped to G3 integration/runtime validation.
